result.execSummary:
The defendant Rapheal Dominic Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
The commitment order did not have the 37 days of credit on it.  Commitment order re-scanned and Clerk of Court's Office contacted to send corrected commitment order to the House of Correction.
cab

Defendant Rapheal Dominic Scott in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Defendant Rapheal Dominic Scott in custody.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Defendant is currently in MSDF on his probation hold.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 75 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date credit for 37 days; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Probation Review Hearing on January 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

cab
Used 6/17/15 dispo date for counts one and two.

Defendant Rapheal Dominic Scott in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
As to count 3:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 26 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 8 MONTHS. Credit given for 12 days time served if revoked.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-Defendant to serve 120 day of condition time, The first 45 days to be served forthwith,  with release privileges for work and elder care, up to 72 hours.  The remaining  75 days of condition time was stayed pending a review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including the DNA charge; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.

As to counts 1 and 2:
On motion of the State and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 1 and 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.

Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Acknowledgment of ineligibility  Copies given to defendant. 
 
The next court date is in Branch 36.



  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rapheal Dominic Scott in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Pursuant to plea negoations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 1 & 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored, and defendant must provide a DNA sample. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
